body: Mike, Attached you can find an example where I only replace the first day of the year with your data and leave the rest in place. This seems to produce a correct sky when you run the GH script. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/gYAzNlJswmiYapcslmWfvW1Q33J3LYhzay8M1E9cqvYLQY2giEw1Yc81ed*LKVn8TdncbsPoZpMbAy3OT69-sTKahdldWMln/correcRadSub.PNG) It seems that a lot of the asymmetry with the sky might also be the result of you having much more sun in the afternoon than in the morning in comparison to the actual weather file.  Also, the fact that the level of sun energy here is almost twice that of any day of the year might also be a source of error. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/gYAzNlJswmg8tVDHYEbpuHMKbDpO6n8oj9pzMu89PsLL3bE3VjkBfkPwPhI6QLX1Cdj994zWO1HsJWlYEj625kapQ7Pie27z/RadComparison.PNG) -Chris
